comments:
Go to the VE preferences for either SWT or Swing and select "null", then hit OK.
It throws an IllegalArgumentException and doesn't accept the value. This is because the eclipse preferences setValue(String, String) interface only accepts a string for the key/value pair... null is not acceptable.

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.PreferenceForwarder.setValue(PreferenceForwarder.java:638)
	at org.eclipse.ve.internal.swt.SWTPreferencePage.performOk(SWTPreferencePage.java:33)
	at org.eclipse.jface.preference.PreferenceDialog$11.run(PreferenceDialog.java:862)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run(InternalPlatform.java:1044)

Fixed...
Stored a constant string NULL_LAYOUT instead of null value and changed the default  layout policies for SWT and Swing to check for this constant when creating commands when a Composite or Panel is dropped.

Released to HEAD for 1.2M1
